summary: Harry: I know the world is ending, but trust me, I can handle it. Draco: How can you possibly HANDLE it? Harry: This ain’t my...
body:
Harry: I know the world is ending, but trust me, I can handle it.

Draco: How can you possibly HANDLE it?

Harry: This ain’t my first rodeo with a homicidal pureblood extremist who wants to murder me.

summary: Harry is a Librarian who runs the kids story time on a Sunday morning. Draco brings his son Scorpius every week without fail -...
body: Harry is a Librarian who runs the kids story time on a Sunday morning. Draco brings his son Scorpius every week without fail - even that one week when Draco was feverish and could barely stand. It absolutely has nothing to do with the cute librarian.

summary: “So what happens if I press this button?”  “Nothing,” replied Draco shooting Harry a cunning smile. Harry leaned forward and...
body:
“So what happens if I press this button?”

“Nothing,” replied Draco shooting Harry a cunning smile. Harry leaned forward and pressed the button. “it’s when you let go, that the situation becomes sticky.”

summary: If you replace a character with Thranduil...
body:
If you replace a character with Thranduil…

…the movie or show instantly gets better

Harry Potter

Voldemort: Can I have your wand, Lucius?

Thranduil as Lucius: Of course, my lord.

Voldemort: *reaches for the wand*

Thranduil as Lucius: Although… will people really want to follow a leader who needs to borrow his wand? I mean, borrow? Isn’t that a thing only peasants do?

Voldemort: …

Thranduil as Lucius: I can call a wandmaker right now and we’ll make you a new one. With gold and diamonds and pearls… Oh, and a carving that says “LV” on the handle!

Snape: For “Lord Voldemort”? Nice.

Thranduil as Lucius: I was thinking “Louis Vuitton”, but that works too.

Voldemort: Ugh, fine.

Game of Thrones

Thranduil as Ned: Robert is not the father of your children, is he?

Cersei: Well, he’s been terrible to me since day one! And I just don’t find him attractive, to be honest.

Thranduil as Ned: Yeah, I did tell him to lose weight…

Cersei: Will you keep my secret then?

Thranduil as Ned: On one condition. We need to get rid of that cunt, Joffrey.

Cersei: You can’t kill my son!

Thranduil as Ned: Who said anything about murder? We’ll just send him to a boarding school. (whispers) Jail. (normal voice) He’ll be fine. You can visit him anytime.

Cersei: Oh, I dunno.

Thranduil as Ned: Once a week you can take him to Starbucks.

Cersei: Deal.

Merlin

Arthur: Dad, why did you ban magic?

Thranduil as Uther: Because the only enchanting thing allowed in Camelot… is me. *flips hair*

tags: Trying to draw/write about hogwarts robes is a hellstorm
summary: Does anybody actually know what Hogwarts robes look like? Because it's mentioned multiple times that the characters tuck their...
body: Does anybody actually know what Hogwarts robes look like? Because it’s mentioned multiple times that the characters tuck their wand in their inner chest pocket which means that the top is open enough to put your arm through, but it’s also mentioned in other occurrences that their wands are in the side pockets of their robes, but in order of the Phoenix, Draco took points away from Ron because his shirt was untucked, but later in the pensieve, Snape is sent in the air by James Potter and his underwear is exposed, and in the goblet of Fire, it’s mentioned that robes are breezy around the legs, but we can’t trust the movie adaptation either because it isn’t mentioned once in the books that the boys wear pants and the girls wear skirts. Everything is so confusing and I don’t know what to do about it.

reblog.comment: Does anybody actually know what Hogwarts robes look like? Because it’s mentioned multiple times that the characters tuck their wand in their inner chest pocket which means that the top is open enough to put your arm through, but it’s also mentioned in other occurrences that their wands are in the side pockets of their robes, but in order of the Phoenix, Draco took points away from Ron because his shirt was untucked, but later in the pensieve, Snape is sent in the air by James Potter and his underwear is exposed, and in the goblet of Fire, it’s mentioned that robes are breezy around the legs, but we can’t trust the movie adaptation either because it isn’t mentioned once in the books that the boys wear pants and the girls wear skirts. Everything is so confusing and I don’t know what to do about it.

trail.content_raw: Does anybody actually know what Hogwarts robes look like? Because it’s mentioned multiple times that the characters tuck their wand in their inner chest pocket which means that the top is open enough to put your arm through, but it’s also mentioned in other occurrences that their wands are in the side pockets of their robes, but in order of the Phoenix, Draco took points away from Ron because his shirt was untucked, but later in the pensieve, Snape is sent in the air by James Potter and his underwear is exposed, and in the goblet of Fire, it’s mentioned that robes are breezy around the legs, but we can’t trust the movie adaptation either because it isn’t mentioned once in the books that the boys wear pants and the girls wear skirts. Everything is so confusing and I don’t know what to do about it.
trail.content: Does anybody actually know what Hogwarts robes look like? Because it’s mentioned multiple times that the characters tuck their wand in their inner chest pocket which means that the top is open enough to put your arm through, but it’s also mentioned in other occurrences that their wands are in the side pockets of their robes, but in order of the Phoenix, Draco took points away from Ron because his shirt was untucked, but later in the pensieve, Snape is sent in the air by James Potter and his underwear is exposed, and in the goblet of Fire, it’s mentioned that robes are breezy around the legs, but we can’t trust the movie adaptation either because it isn’t mentioned once in the books that the boys wear pants and the girls wear skirts.
